data.title: Dr. Maxime Dagenais
data.meta_description: A. Books Craig, Béatrice and Maxime Dagenais. The Land Divided: The Upper St. John Valley, from World War One to present. (In preparation for publication). Dagenais, Maxime. The Land In-Between: The Madawaska Territory 13000 BP to World War One. Commissioned by the National Parks Service (US) and the Maine Acadian Heritage Council. Written jointly with…
data.text:
Dagenais, Maxime. “Arrowhead Sash.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (June 2016) Coauthored with Severine Craig.

Dagenais, Maxime. “The Early American Republic and the 1837-38 Canadian Rebellions.” (Feature Article) Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (April 2016)

Dagenais, Maxime. “Parti bleu.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (March 2016)

Dagenais, Maxime. “Parti rouge.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (March 2016)

Dagenais, Maxime. “Parti canadien.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (February 2016)

Dagenais, Maxime. “Thomas Louis Tremblay.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (August 2015)

Dagenais, Maxime. “The ‘Van Doos’ and the Great War.” (Feature Article) Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (July 2015)

Dagenais, Maxime. “Ludger Duvernay.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (April 2015)

Dagenais, Maxime. “Napoléon Aubin.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (March 2015)

Dagenais, Maxime. “Madawaska: A Canadian-American Borderland, from Colonization to Division.” (Feature Article) Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (October 2014)

Dagenais, Maxime. “The Special Council of Lower Canada, 1838-41.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (October 2014)

Dagenais, Maxime. “La Charte des valeurs du Québec: historique.” Historica Canada: Encyclopédie canadienne/The Canadian Encyclopaedia (December 2013)

*This article was also published in Encyclopedia Britannica

Dagenais, Maxime, review of Ending the French Revolution: Violence, Justice, and Repression from the Terror to Napoleon, by Howard G. Brown, Histoire Sociale/Social History 41, 82 (November 2008): 3p.

E. Non-Refereed Publications

Dagenais, Maxime. “The Wilson Institute for Canadian History: Introduction and Vision of Canadian History.” Borealia: A Group Blog on Early Canadian History (2016)

Dagenais, Maxime. “2015 IHAF: An Overview from an Early North Americanist.” Borealia: A Group Blog on Early Canadian History (2015)

Dagenais, Maxime. “The ‘Canadian Revolution,” the Early American Republic, and Slavery?” Borealia: A Group Blog on Early Canadian History (2015)

* This article was also “highlighted” on Active History: History Matters (November 2015)

*A French version was also published as “La “Révolution canadienne,” la jeune république Américaine, et l’esclavage?”

Dagenais, Maxime. “Élection générale de 1952 à Saint-Henri: Le ministre Delisle battu par un libéral!” Les Potins des Tanneries 22, No. 2 (Summer 2012): 2p.
